intro: Hieracium lundardalicum, commonly known as the Lundard's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
